intro: Senegalia welwitschii, commonly known as the welwitschiacandelabra, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its branching, often thorny structure and its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by flat, bean-like pods containing seeds. Its leaves are typically small and alternate, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Senegalia welwitschii plays a role in local ecosystems and has been used traditionally for various purposes.
